page.title: 11Amaryllis's Day
page.content: I get up at 7.45, get dressed, go down stairs and have some cereals for breakfast. I brush my hair and teeth, feed my rabbits then go up to the bus stop. The bus takes me to school in Sharnbrook. We go into school at 8.55. First our teacher calls the register, then we go to assembly. In assembly we hear a story and sing a hymn. At 9.30 we come back to class and do maths till breaktime. After play we do an English activity till 12.00. After lunch we come back in and have environmental studies, P.E. and art. In the Summer we use the swimming pool. I go home on the mini bus at 3.20. At home I watch T.V., have my tea, and on Wednesdays go to Brownies from 6.00 till 7.30. I usually read my Enid Blyton books in bed before I go to sleep at about half past nine.
